intro: Licania tontoutensis, commonly known as the Tontouta licania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
